intro: Euphrasia pectinata leptostachys, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals and are often adorned with a dark spot at the base. Euphrasia pectinata leptostachys is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
